div.p: Acc. 49, vol. 58, no. 738, Colonial Secretary's Office correspondence, State Records Office of Western Australia, Perth.

1877 26 Novr
MS is from a letterbook with the year entered at the top of each page and the dates marked in the margin.

In reply to your letter of the 26th
sic. See M to H. Ord, 20 November 1877. instant wherein you apply to become a naturalised British Subject in this Colony I am directed by His Excellency the Lieutenant Governor to inform you and at the same time to express his regret that under the conditions of the Naturalisation Act 35 Victoria No. 2 he is unable to entertain your application in as much as it does not appear that you have come to reside in the Colony with the intention of settling therein.
